reviewText: I can understand people's appreciation of this film if they just view it as a clever mystery, but "The Mirror Cracked From Side to Side" is so obviously based on the life of Gene Tierney, a beautiful actress from the 1940s and 1950s, that it surprised me when Hollywood made a film of the story. Tierney was a significant star and you'd think Hollywood would have had more respect for her. Though her story  wouldn't have affected the English as much, it was still unpleasant to see  "Mystery" do it.Gene Tierney's tragedy was well known at the time.  She went to a outing for American soldiers during WW2, and one of the female soldiers , who had German Measles, got out of a sick bed to see her.  Tierney, who was pregnant, came down with the malady and as a result had a developmentally disabled child.  I don't know how well the link between German Measles and retardation was known during WW2, but it became very well known eventually and Tierney had a breakdown, supposedly because of it.Tierney was still alive when the Taylor/Hudson movie came out and I couldn't understand how Hollywood could utilize her tragedy for entertainment purposes.Of course Christie wrote a great mystery "Murder on the Orient Express" based on the Lindbergh tragedy, but the movie didn't come out until over 40 years later and it wasn't a case of Hollywood exploiting one of its own.
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: I have watched this movie over and over. Not because of the acting from the American actors, I do not know the names, but because of the story and the acting from the British cast! I love the one liners throughout the movie, my favorite being.."Oh Jane!! Can you read my thoughts!?" What a fun show, and the more you watch, the more you see and hear! Two thumbs WAY UP:)
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: Aunt Jane finds herself at a local an annual summer garden party hosted by the new owners of Gossington Hall. The new owner is an aging movie star who is at odds with the studio producing the latest movie. A visitor mysteriously dies. People start dropping like flies and the Movie Star (Marina) knows she is next. The title of the movie is taken from "The Lady of Shallot"Joan Hickson is Miss Marple. Agatha Christie always considered her as the ideal Miss Marple; she shows this through her reserve savvy. Jane takes an interactive interest in the mystery and yet each character as part of the discovery, stands on their own. The ending of the story is as is in life, it is appropriate not black and white judgmental.
summary: Mirror Cracked from Side to Side
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: Loved seeing Clare Bloom..................I like Joan Hickson in this role very much.  She just has something special.  Her facial expressions are priceless....all the acting was superb.........enjoyed Barry Newman also.  The English countryside always plays a central part for me.
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewerName: Jacques COULARDEAU "A soul doctor, so to say"
reviewText: The poor village of Saint Mary Mead is invaded by some American actors and actresses for the shooting of a film. The main actress was actually raised in the village before moving to America. It's obvious Miss Marple does not consider cinema actors as very respectable people, though that is no reason to kill them. But apparently it is by far enough to justify their suicide. The story is sordid about the past, but that is nearly nothing when compared with the sordidness of the present they impose onto themselves and one another. Working conditions of actors and actresses are horrific and producers are the worst exploiters that can exist and they deserve our full and complete condescending contempt. Add into that picture a couple of adopted children, rejected afterwards, and then a real child reduced to an incurable fate by German measles during the pregnancy and you have the squalid reality of this case. So it is nearly nice of Jane Marple to overlook the slight detail that the death of that actress was not entirely natural though it looks suicidal, or maybe not entirely suicidal though it looks absolutely natural, or whatever other mixture with artificial added in the lot. In one word good riddance and just hope God is just as understanding as we are not.Dr Jacques COULARDEAU
summary: Suicide may be a solution to horror
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: Again, Miss Hickson does not fail to entertain. This story especially is very well done.  The story has a lot of twists and turns and just when you think.....you have it........another wrinkle occurs.
summary: Joan and Miss Marple are one
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: SAME AS ALL HICKSON'S MISS MARPLE. AS IN MY OTHER REVIEWS, SHE IS THE BEST MARPLE EVER. ALL MOVIES IN THIS SERIES GIVE YOU A GOOD MYSTERY.
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: Miss Marple has her work cut out for her in this Mystery. An american movie star and her husband move to St Mary Mead and buy Gossington Hall. A locale, Heather Badcok dies at the annual fete that is held at Gossington Hall. Why would someome want to kill her? Was it an accident or was it meant for someone else? Than another death occurs.  You will gasp and admire how Miss Marple uncovers what is going on.
summary: Mirror Carcked fromm Side to Side
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: This is one of the best of the TV Miss Marple films. there are stunning performances by Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom,Glynnis Barber,Barry Newman,Elizabeth Garvie, Margaret Courtnay,and Gwen Watford.Watch this film.
Title: Miss Marple: Mirror Cracked From Side to Side VHS

reviewText: I know the reviews say that this is the best Miss Marple movie but I liked the one with Elizabeth Taylor & Rock Hudson better.
